data.name: Puzzle Pelago - A Drag & Drop Economy
data.detailed_description:
Join our Discord!


About the Game

Do you like puzzles? Do you like base building games? Look no further!



The islands of the Puzzle Pelago have been devastated by a storm, and now the islanders cannot figure out how everything was laid out! Space is tight on the tiny islands, and roads may not cross - lest the stubborn haulers run into each other!


The core mechanic of Puzzle Pelago is simple - create new workshops by dragging from existing workshops or resources. From a forest, you can drag a lumber jack that produces logs. From a lumber jack, you can drag a saw mill that produces planks. You can even combine two goods to produce a more advanced one: combine ore and coal to produce iron, or tools and planks to produce furniture!

But even though the task starts simple, each island you visit will become more challenging than the previous one! Can you help rebuild them all???


  • Clean, colorful graphics with juicy and responsive animations
  • 100+ Puzzles
  • Easy to learn, hard to master
  • 13 Different goods

data.short_description: Puzzle Pelago turns the classic ware-chain based economy sim into a challenging puzzle! Help rebuild the network of goods production via deceptively simple drag & drop mechanics. Produce various goods exactly where the islanders need them - from wooden planks and wheat to barrels, beer and bread.
data.reviews:
“Using its simple mechanics, even those with no experience will be able to discover these genres and perhaps find a new love for these strategic and puzzling challenges. [...] It won’t be an easy ride to the top, but it will certainly give your brain a good exercise!”
Indie Games +

“Fortunately the rest of the game is a cute little puzzler, that has its difficulty ramp up slowly and calmly. And there are over 100 of them, so you’re getting a good deal.”
Buried Treasure

“If you love puzzle games, Puzzle Pelago – A Drag & Drop Economy is a real no-brainer. It’s pleasant to look at. [...] There is enough play time here to justify the price point if you’re looking for a challenge.”
The Videogame Backlog
